alert.note: Alert for Northern Monterey Bay; Santa Cruz Mountains (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 11 at 10:53PM PST by NWS Monterey
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Santa Cruz County through 1130 PM PST... At 1053 PM PST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Santa Cruz, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Santa Cruz, Scotts Valley, Capitola, Live Oak, Aptos, Felton, Soquel, Twin Lakes, Opal Cliffs, Rio Del Mar, Day Valley and Lexington Hills. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Northern Monterey Bay; Santa Cruz Mountains
